sanger.argml.graph.model
Class Edge

java.lang.Object
  sanger.argml.graph.model.Edge
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Edge>, java.lang.Iterable<Mutation>
public class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Edge>, java.lang.Iterable<Mutation>

An ARG edge, directed forward in time. Edges have an active region which contains all the positions in the sequence with ancestral material and a length. Mutations can also occure on the edge.

Author:
Lior Galanti

Constructor Detail

Edge

protected Edge(Edge edge,
               Vertex source,
               NaturalSet region)
Constructs a new transitional edge. This is part of the procedure for cropping or copying a genealogy. Copying is preformed forward in time and creates an edge from the source vertex in the new genealogy to the target vertex in the original. The new edge's active region contains only coordinates and mutations also contained in region.

Parameters:
edge - Edge in the original genealogy.
source - Source vertex in the original genealogy.
region - Region to copy when constructing the the new edge.

Edge

protected Edge(Vertex source,
               Vertex target,
               NaturalSet region)
Constructs a new edge connecting source and target vertices.

Parameters:
source - Source Vertex.
target - Target Vertex.
region - Active region of the edge.
